intro: Nigella orientalis, commonly known as black cumin or Roman coriander, is an annual herb native to the Mediterranean region. It produces small, yellow flowers that develop into distinctive, spherical seed pods containing numerous tiny, dark-colored seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branched stems with finely divided leaves. Its seeds are rich in essential oils and have been used in traditional medicine and cuisine for centuries. The botanical features of Nigella orientalis make it a valuable plant in both horticulture and herbal remedies.
